fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Parts of Greenland were reported to have reached 40F above normal earlier this month, which we reported as being 4.4C above normal. We mistakenly converted the absolute temperature of 40F, which is 4.4C, rather than converting the rise of 40F, which is a rise of 22C (Sled dogs wade in ankle-deep water as Arctic ice sheet melts ‘big and early’, 18 June, page 27). • Other recently corrected articles include: Oregon’s Republican senators flee capitol to delay vote on emissions reduction plan Climbers land plane near summit of Mont Blanc with police in pursuit Magic and mystery on the Isle of Lewis, Scotland Plucked from obscurity: why bluegrass is making a comeback
